news_header: The Menendez brothers, convicted of murdering their parents in 1989, may soon be eligible for parole following new evidence suggesting they were victims of abuse.
news_text: Erik and Lyle Menendez, convicted of murdering their parents in 1989, are closer to potential parole after a Los Angeles County district attorney recommended resentencing due to new evidence of alleged abuse. The case, which has captivated the public and inspired a Netflix series, involved the brothers claiming they acted in self-defense after years of emotional and sexual abuse. A hearing is scheduled to discuss the resentencing recommendation, but the case remains controversial, with mixed opinions from the public and family members. The brothers are currently serving life sentences without parole.
